title: Coronation Street fans in frenzy as ITV bosses confirm soap will be welcoming two huge new additions
text:
TV Coronation Street fans in frenzy as ITV bosses confirm soap will be welcoming two huge new additions Producers have big plans for the show as they prepare to broadcast six episodes a week later this year Share Coronation Street is getting a new business and a new street Share Get soaps   Thank you for subscribing! Coronation Street is getting a new business - and the news has sent fans into a guessing frenzy. 
Bosses at ITV have embarked on an ambitious extension of the set for the show in Media City, Salford, Greater Manchester. 
It heralds the broadcast of six episodes a week later this year. 
A police station, a school and a court have already been promised, but now it appears more businesses will be moving into Weatherfield with a new business on a new street; Kitchener St. The news has sent fans into a guessing frenzy (Photo: PA) 
The new name of the street could be a blind by producers with hints that we could be getting Tile Street as well as other roads often referred to over the years. 
The planning application - submitted earlier this month - shows the new two storey building with proposed signage on the front which gives little clue to the nature of the business. 
The location of the set store would also be around the same place as the upcoming construction on Victoria Street. Since Roy’s, Tracy’s flower shop and a couple of other businesses are on Victoria Street it makes sense to carry on commercial businesses around the corner. 
Coronation Street’s executive producer Kieran Roberts has already revealed more about the show’s plans when it expands to six episodes a week in the autumn. 
While the broadcaster has not yet revealed its scheduling plans, Kieran has explained the expansion will allow for a stronger emphasis on comedy, as well as a focus on lesser-known characters. Corrie is set to broadcast of six episodes a week later this year (Photo: ITV) 
Kieron added that it would maximise screen time for a number of lesser-seen actors with additional storylines. 
The expansion will also lead to more than 40 new jobs for crew and writers, to facilitate the expansion. 
“The street will open up a whole range of new possibilities for the writers to work with,” he said. 
“It’s inevitable that a whole new street of homes will bring new families and drama with it.” 
There are four main streets currently on the long-running soap, and many more that are often mentioned but not seen on camera. 
Rosamund Street used to be the home of cornershop the Kabin, Victoria Street is where Roy’s Rolls is based, and the bistro and garage are on Viaduct Street.
